text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Nigerian stock exchange loses five billion naira as funds shift to money market.
- Total Nigeria Plc plans to divest from Nigerian Gas Cylinders in which it holds a majority of 51 percent.
- Nigeria will next month begin to export gas following completion of $569 million Escravos gas gathering project operated by Chevron Corp's Nigerian joint venture.
- Sierra Leone coup leader shuns all entreaties to step down and names cabinet.
- Federal government approves that state oil company Nigerian National Petroleum Corp should insure its assets with a consortium of four insurance firms.
- Nigerian student George Ibikunle Williams graduates with some of the highest honours at Rutgers University in New Jersey, United States.
- Oil minister Dan Etete says board of directors of Nigerian Liquefied Natural Gas Company was sacked to protect the interest of some "marginalised" shareholders.
- Forty eight more private firms were licensed at the weekend to operate telecommunications services.
- Central bank withdraws 10.6 billion naira from circulation.
- Police chief Ibrahim Coomasie orders 24-hour security alert in opposition heartland, southwest of Nigeria, over the fourth anniversary of the annulled June 12, 1993 presidential election.
- Banks refund 700 million naira to central bank representing sanctions for flouting rules governing weekly forex auction.
